meanings.definition: The period of time during the day when a person works at a job.
meanings.sent1: During the dayshift, employees are busy with their tasks.
meanings.sent2: I prefer the dayshift because I can see the sunlight while working.
meanings.sent3: The dayshift workers always have the freshest coffee in the office.
meanings.sent4: The dayshift is like a bustling beehive of activity.
meanings.sent5: The dayshift is when the office comes alive with productivity.

meanings.definition: To work during the daytime rather than at night.
meanings.sent1: She dayshifts at the hospital to spend evenings with her family.
meanings.sent2: I dayshift so I can enjoy my evenings relaxing at home.
meanings.sent3: He dayshifts to catch the morning sunrise before work.
meanings.sent4: Dayshifting feels more natural to me than working nights.
meanings.sent5: They dayshift to have more time for outdoor activities after work.
